message: The company’s always encouraged drivers to play a role in the end of the scourge, but the new initiative is a formalized program. It not only urges drivers to be aware, but also provides them with the information needed to recognize a victim who may be riding in their car.

data.description: Uber's effort to repair its image continue under new CEO Dara Khosrowshahi. The ride hailing company is partnering with law enforcement and human trafficking groups to get drivers to help spot victims and inform them on what steps they should take. For details, go to TheDetroitBureau.com.
data.title: Uber Working to Fight Human Trafficking | TheDetroitBureau.com
